results.title: Graphs correlation regression elasticity (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Deals with a study of the principles by which resources are allocated and production organised. Andrew Pollard examines a number of statistical tools frequently used by economists. These include the graph, regression and multiple regression

results.title: Graphing linear equations
results.creator_credit: Bill Hanlon, Carla Cody Weaver and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to graph a linear equation by finding the value for x and y. It also familiarises students with the correct vocabulary to use when describing linear equations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Graphic communication
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Alexander Milsky
results.brief_description: A series of basic geometric shapes are used to illustrates how signs, symbols and diagrams can be employed to represent written or verbal information. Quite complex concepts can often be conveyed effectively by the use of simple symbols.

results.title: Grapevine pruning
results.brief_description: The method of pruning sultana grapes developed as a result of research on vine buds and shoots, is shown. The correct methods of pruning Zante currants, Gordos, and other varieties of grapes is also shown. The research work was carried out by CSIRO at the Commonwealth Research Station, Merbein, Victoria.

results.title: Granville
results.brief_description: Depicts the aftermath of the railway disaster at Granville, New South Wales in February 1977. Eighty-two persons were killed and over eighty were injured. The film shows the rescue operations in action. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: Depicts the aftermath of the railway disaster at Granville, New South Wales in February 1977. Eighty-two persons were killed and over eighty were injured. The film shows the rescue operations in action. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Grant Wood 1892-1942 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents the story of Grant Wood, an American self-taught artist who painted the gentle curves of his neighbouring hills, the neatly ploughed fields, the daily routine of western life as well as such classic themes in American History as Paul Revere’s ride. The film brings together a collection of Grant Wood’s best work. Credits include: photography by John Lewis; music by Lan Adomian. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Grant Mudford. Max Pam
results.creator_credit: Roger Young, Jeff Atkinson, Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two thirty minute programs: 1. “Grant Mudford” Born in Australia in 1944, photographer, Grant Mudford, now lives and works in California. He prefers anonymous architectural subject matter photographed in a manner that transforms it. 2. “Max Pam” Born in Melbourne, Max Pam left at age 19 for Katmandu. He returned to Australia in 1984 having established an international reputation as a photographer of Asia. Photography, for Pam, has the capacity to capture certain moments which elude the writer, the filmmaker or the painter.

results.title: Granny lives in Galway
results.brief_description: An excerpt from the film ‘Fligh of the Doves’, focusing on a story about a brother and sister who escape from a cruel stepfather in England and search for their grandmother who lives in a cottage in Galway, Ireland. Based on the book by Walter Macken.
